reviews.text: It is always a fun time and a great night out no matter what is showing!
Home town feeling. Great place for the town a d enjoying watching a movie here
Great place to watch a movie. I felt like a kid.
I went there as a kid and love that its still around
A cute, historic theater deeply beloved by the local community
Great festival! Come once you will be hooked.
Great location, food, local beer and wine. Music lineup was solid. Laid back and easy to get to.
Great event in historic Madison Indiana.

Pretty bad pricing . Not sure how many events the past reviews have been too, but $35 just to walk past the gate is a little ridiculous, especially to listen to amateur bands. Then that $35 doesn't include any food. You have to then buy food tickets. So count on over $50 just to try a 6th of the BBQ there.
Wonderful event, totally affordable and great music abounds. An ideal weekend getaway in a charming river town .And the ribs ain't bad either.
Absolutely Fantastic!! It was cold outside today, did not get to experience the outside. But will definitely be back again to explore the outdoor garden and arts!! Thanks for the experience!!
Excellent service with a smile and true interest in their customers! Wines good too!

The place is beautiful. We had our engagement photos done at this location. We also been showing my parents the area and we went for a Wine Tasting. Ended up buying 3 bottles if that tells you how much we enjoyed our time there.
The wine is all very sweet including there dry. Beautiful gardens.
They have wonderful products and a great atmosphere. The outside property  is pretty as well. With complimentary tastings you'll find something you enjoy.

My happy place. Cozy and friendly, charming proprietors who love what they do. Great wine, cheeses, salamis/sausages, baked-on-site artisanal breads, etc ... it's a fabulous listening room for music, too. There is no sweeter place to spend a winter evening. The patio is fun in summer!

Great customer service and a wonderful atmosphere!!! We came here on our 23 anniversary for a wine tasting and went back the following day for some good music. People were great! We definitely would come back!!!
Great atmosphere, good wine, cheese, meats, and artisan breads! And great music, too!
Had a wonderful time, good cider, cheese and bread. Great music, great people.
If you want to support live, local musicians, visit TFW on a Saturday night! Great music, great atmosphere, excellent wine.
Good food, but like other reviews have said, the one gentleman was not very friendly, but not rude either. The other staff was very nice and the food was better than average. Coffee is good too.
Very knowledgeable and helpful with my ground coffee purchase.  The earl grey tea is delicious
The food is so good. Also the waiters and waitress are all so kind. I love your tomato basal soup,iced chai lattes, and your sugar cream pie. I rate you 5 stars.
Great people, excellent coffee, and delicious homemade treats!
Good food and the staff were friendly.
Great service from staff. Food has been great & desserts are outta this world. ..highly recommend this place!

Step in for a lovely spot to enjoy lunch or coffee, and don't forget the dessert. Dining in allows you to enjoy the art available for sale and some fine kitchen/home goods available also. Kitchen is open until 3pm.
Great place to relax and enjoy a nice comfortable and warm lunch. Though open til 5:00pm they serve lunch until 3:00 pm. However, you can still get great desserts anytime.
Wonderfully quaint, with interesting, well done artwork to enjoy. The food we had for lunch was delightful. I plan to return soon!
The best Reuben, gallery 115 style and,of course, desserts.  You'll enjoy the atmosphere and the people as well as the food.

It was a great atmosphere, people were having a blast. A birthday party was going on, plus people in general was having fun. The appetizers were so-so, but great after work place to meet friends or have a cozy dinner with your significant other.

My favorite when visiting Madison. Try the chickles. Anytime I come here, the patrons are as friendly as the staff. Decent food options for a bar / restaurant. Anytime I visit Madison, this place is a must! Great views all around, from the hills, to the Ohio River. A cozy little nook of a bar, with small town friendliness.
Cool atmosphere, and beautiful as well. The bartenders are fun and can make lots of nice drinks. The food was ok, I wasn't super impressed by it. Overall it was an enjoyable experience
Wonderful,  historic hotel. Great drinks and delicious food.

Hadn't been back to Madison for years, and I always enjoyed the Broadway.  We sat outside on a nice day and had a great lunch and some nice cold brew.  Our server was nice and fun, and we chatted with some nice locals outside.  The Broadway still has it!  Glad we went back to check it out!

My sister and I shared our Birthdays at Key West Shrimp House in Madison In.
We had an excellent dinner overlooking the beautiful Ohio River. Davie our waiter did a superb job. He was so friendly and conscientious, he made us feel so special on our Birthday. The drinks were great and we were able to park close to the door. 
Key West is upscale dining where you can take your family or have just an intimate dinner for two. I loved it.

Food and service was awesome as always. We drive here from Seymour. It is always worth the trip. Been going here for 3 or 4 years. Never had a bad experience. My daughter thinks this is the only place for seafood.
My husband and I eat here every time we ate in the area. I've never had a bad meal our service. It's our go to place for great seafood.

This place has pretty decent food. Price ranging from 19 to 35 on average, it comes with salad bar and soup when you order normal entrees. The particular server I had made few mistakes but was very very friendly.

Overall, it think it was great but in terms of some maintenance and utility usage of restaurant, I think it could do better. The food like I said is good, but don't expect a high end quality. Comfy place and food in summary I suppose.

Don't let the prices scare you off. At first we were a little shocked but what you get is what's shocking! Unlimited salad bar with food made from scratch and a bowl of soup. And their bread basket isn't your grandma's bread basket way better.
 The food is amazing service and atmosphere was wonderful. I can't wait to go back. I got the Norfolk and fiance got the stuffed cod. It's Madison s best hidden secret
Good food, but like other reviews have said, the one gentleman was not very friendly, but not rude either. The other staff was very nice and the food was better than average. Coffee is good too.
Very knowledgeable and helpful with my ground coffee purchase.  The earl grey tea is delicious
The food is so good. Also the waiters and waitress are all so kind. I love your tomato basal soup,iced chai lattes, and your sugar cream pie. I rate you 5 stars.
Great people, excellent coffee, and delicious homemade treats!
Good food and the staff were friendly.
This place is great. They have a wide variety of choices. It is a nice atmosphere. This is a must try! Every time I go here, I am just blown away at how good this place is. One of the best in town!

My first time here. I don't eat meat so there aren't really any options for me at this place. However, the staff was super friendly and helpful. I ended up trying their bread sticks and a large strawberry cookie which they recommended. Both were delicious and I took a to go menu in case the family wanted to try out the place. Seems like a good place to eat and get away from everything for a second.
Excellent food! Everything on the menu that we have tried was great!
Good food. Good wait staff . I enjoy eating here. The desserts are good too.
Potato soup was delicious. Watch out for the cake... huge servings and it's so fabulous you will want to eat the entire piece. Quick, friendly service.
Great service from staff. Food has been great & desserts are outta this world. ..highly recommend this place!

Step in for a lovely spot to enjoy lunch or coffee, and don't forget the dessert. Dining in allows you to enjoy the art available for sale and some fine kitchen/home goods available also. Kitchen is open until 3pm.
Great place to relax and enjoy a nice comfortable and warm lunch. Though open til 5:00pm they serve lunch until 3:00 pm. However, you can still get great desserts anytime.
Wonderfully quaint, with interesting, well done artwork to enjoy. The food we had for lunch was delightful. I plan to return soon!
The best Reuben, gallery 115 style and,of course, desserts.  You'll enjoy the atmosphere and the people as well as the food.
Good food, but like other reviews have said, the one gentleman was not very friendly, but not rude either. The other staff was very nice and the food was better than average. Coffee is good too.
Very knowledgeable and helpful with my ground coffee purchase.  The earl grey tea is delicious
The food is so good. Also the waiters and waitress are all so kind. I love your tomato basal soup,iced chai lattes, and your sugar cream pie. I rate you 5 stars.
Great people, excellent coffee, and delicious homemade treats!
Good food and the staff were friendly.
